rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you

Line 1: Line 1: â
[[File:PNClogo.svg|right]]
 
[[File:National City logo.svg|right]]
[[File:National City logo.svg|right]]
The '''National City acquisition by PNC''' was the deal by [[PNC Financial Services]] to acquire [[National City Corp.]] on [[October 24]], [[2008]] after National City became a victim of the [[subprime mortgage crisis]]. The deal received much controversy due to PNC using [[Troubled Asset Relief Program|TARP funds]] to buy National City only hours after accepting the funds while National City itself was denied funds, as well as civic pride for the city of [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], where National City was based.<ref name="NatCity">{{cite web |date= November 16, 2008|url = http://blog.cleveland.com/business/2008/11/pncnational_city_bank_deal_dra.html|title = PNC-National City bank deal draws criticism|publisher = Â© 2009 Cleveland Live, Inc.| accessdate = October 28, 2009 | last= |quote=}}</ref>
The '''National City acquisition by PNC''' was the deal by [[PNC Financial Services]] to acquire [[National City Corp.]] on [[October 24]], [[2008]] after National City became a victim of the [[subprime mortgage crisis]]. The deal received much controversy due to PNC using [[Troubled Asset Relief Program|TARP funds]] to buy National City only hours after accepting the funds while National City itself was denied funds, as well as civic pride for the city of [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]], where National City was based.<ref name="NatCity">{{cite web |date= November 16, 2008|url = http://blog.cleveland.com/business/2008/11/pncnational_city_bank_deal_dra.html|title = PNC-National City bank deal draws criticism|publisher = Â© 2009 Cleveland Live, Inc.| accessdate = October 28, 2009 | last= |quote=}}</ref>
